text: Jack Benny (born Benjamin Kubelsky; February 14, 1894 - December 26, 1974) was an American comedian and actor. He was born in Chicago and grew up in Waukegan, Illinois. His mother was a Lithuanian immigrant; his father was a Jewish immigrant from Poland. From 1932 to 1955, Benny had a radio show. The first title of the show was The Canada Dry Ginger Ale Program, but it was later called "The Jack Benny Program". His television program was broadcast from 1950 to 1965. ==Death== Benny died of pancreatic cancer in Beverly Hills, California at the age of 80.https://www.nytimes.com/1974/12/28/archives/jack-benny-80-dies-of-cancer-on-coast-jack-benny-80-dies-of-cancer.html | Jack Benny, 80, Dies of Cancer on Coast - The New York Times == References == == Other websites == * Category:1894 births Category:1974 deaths Category:Actors from Chicago Category:American movie actors Category:American radio actors Category:American stage actors Category:American television actors Category:American television producers Category:Cancer deaths in Los Angeles County, California Category:Comedians from Chicago Category:Deaths from pancreatic cancer Category:Television personalities from Chicago
title: Jack Benny
